definition: A categorization of individuals based on their age, typically used to refer to a specific range or group of people within a population. It is commonly employed in sociological studies, market research, and educational contexts to analyze and understand different age cohorts or generations.

examples.german: Die Altersgruppe der 20- bis 30-Jährigen ist besonders aktiv.
examples.english: The age group of 20 to 30 year olds is particularly active.

examples.german: Die Altersgruppe der Senioren wächst stetig.
examples.english: The age group of seniors is growing steadily.

examples.german: Die Altersgruppe der Kinder und Jugendlichen benötigt besondere Betreuung.
examples.english: The age group of children and adolescents requires special care.

examples.german: Die Altersgruppe der 40- bis 50-Jährigen ist in der Regel berufstätig.
examples.english: The age group of 40 to 50 year olds is usually employed.

examples.german: Die Altersgruppe der Teenager ist oft von neuen Technologien begeistert.
examples.english: The age group of teenagers is often enthusiastic about new technologies.
